It's the same with the boxes, not everyone has that intuitive feel for it.=

 
  Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: urkel23@...: Fri, 1=
2 Oct 2007 22:56:23 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Spur of the monet session

=



Yeah, anybody can buy a radio but if you don't know what your listening =
for it causes a problem. I'm not sure of a certain # of people, but i do no=
t believe everyone can make out the voices. I also think that some files i =
get that are so clear and nobody else hears proves that it was meant for on=
ly me. I've accepted that now, but i feel if you can understand the message=
s---you have a gift and should use it.-Steve H.--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om, Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:>> > Thanks. This is without a =
box, so if interested parties would like to try this just send check to....=
..JUST KIDDING! The point is you don't need anything special, the technolog=
y just doesn't matter--other than a radio of somekind-- they use what you u=
se! All I do is automate the process. If my phone hadn't died I would have =
sent a pix of the boom box. It's just a mini boom box cassette/AM/FM radio.=
 Probably cost 20 bucks brand new, a GPX brand, "Grand Prix Home and Go mus=
ic system with stereo cassette recorder and bass boost". I did the session =
at work, it shows you can do it anywhere. The dial isn't even a single turn=
 dial, it takes multiple twists (revolutions) to scan the entire band, or o=
ne could wobble between a few stations. > > Frank-S> > > > > > > To: evp-it=
c@...: paranormalinvestigating@...: Fri, 12 Oct 2007 13:43:02 -0400Subject:=
 RE: [EVP-ITC] Spur of the monet session> > > > > Frank, I hear both the wa=
y you hear them the "doesn't bother field " is clear as a bell.I think the =
new boxes you are making are more along the lines of that type of clarityas=
 apposed to the older boxes that generate a lot of white noise. Every day w=
e get a step closer. Bruce> > Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team =
> > > To: evp-itc@...: franks-boxes@...: Fri, 12 Oct 2007 10:39:53 -0600Sub=
ject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Spur of the monet session> > > Yeah, it probably just d=
epends on conditions. #3 was kinda iffy, and made out of noise. Here's anot=
her. I just now went out to Field Elemenary to check a locate request. A lo=
cate request is to notify us that someone is digging somewhere in Littleton=
, and I have to verify that it will not hit any of our burried fiber. This =
was far enough away to not "bother" Field's fiber. Mostly I like to put the=
se up cuz it shows you need nothing but simple equipment, just an AM radio,=
 and I used the built in recorder, so not even recording from the speaker! =
It's so friggin' close to proof, but just can't quite get it there! Frustra=
tes me to no end. Frank-S> > > To: evp-itc@...: paranormalinvestigating@...=
: Fri, 12 Oct 2007 12:10:17 -0400Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Spur of the monet s=
ession> > > Frank, I hear 1, 2 and 4 as you do very clearly but can't make =
out more than 'want'in #3. I had really good sucess with the manual sweeps =
also if you remember the posts. Bruce> > Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investig=
ating Team > > > To: evp-itc@...: franks-boxes@...: Fri, 12 Oct 2007 09:57:=
22 -0600Subject: [EVP-ITC] Spur of the monet session> > > I was checking ou=
t a little boom box here, and decided to do a quickie session using manual =
sweep of the AM band. This is at work(don't tell the boss!). The one about =
the male dog might refer to the mate to this female poodle we have now. For=
 those unfamilar, our daughter in-law knows someone that rescues dogs, and =
she was tryuing to get rid of some of her too many animals. The daughter in=
-law at first gave us the male poodle a few weeks ago, but he was deaf, bli=
nd, and someone, probably the puppy mill he came from, pulled all his teeth=
. He was too much to deal with, he fell down our stairs twice, and we felt =
he was suffereing too much, so we took him to the Dumb Friends League. Now =
we have his mate, but she has most of her teeth, and can hear, see and is a=
 little sweetie. #4 is hopefully accurate. Frank-S> > Help yourself to FREE=
 treats served up daily at the Messenger Caf=E9. Stop by today! > > Windows=
 Live Hotmail and Microsoft Office Outlook =96 together at last. Get it now=
! > > Peek-a-boo FREE Tricks Treats for You! Get 'em! > > Climb to the top =
